hook.text: There's a US court that approved 99.97% of surveillance requests. You've probably never heard of it.

buildup.text: The Foreign Intelligence Surveillance Court was created in 1978 to oversee government wiretap requests.

discovery.text: FISC hearings are secret. Only the government argues its case. No defense attorney, no public record.

twist.text: After 9/11, FISC expanded from approving targeted wiretaps to authorizing bulk collection on entire populations.

climax.text: A court designed to check power became a rubber stamp for it. Oversight without opposition isn't oversight.

punchline.text: A secret court with no opposition is just a permission slip.

quiz.question: What is unusual about FISA Court proceedings?
options: Only the government presents its case, in secret
